section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This subtitle applies to skills-based amusement devices regulated by the Commission under Criminal Law Article, §§12-301 and 12-301.1, and State Government Article, Title 9, Subtitle 1B, Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: In this subtitle, the following terms have the meaning indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Merchandiser device” means a skills-based amusement device by which a player controls a mechanical or electromechanical claw or other device to retrieve merchandise or prizes.
“Minimal value” means having a wholesale value of not more than $30.
“Reasonable player” means a first-time player of average levels of intelligence, physical and mental skills, reaction time, and dexterity.
“Redemption device” means a skills-based amusement device that issues only tickets, tokens or other objects that represent or that can be converted into merchandise or prizes.
“Skill” means:
A learned ability of doing a thing competently;
A particular ability, strategy, or tactic;
A coordinated set of actions, including, but not limited to, eye-hand coordination;
Dexterity, fluency, or coordination in the executing of learned physical or mental tasks or combination thereof;
Technical proficiency or expertise;
Development or implementation of a strategy or tactics in order to achieve a goal; or
Knowledge of the means or methods of accomplishing a task.
“Skills-based amusement device” means a machine, apparatus, or device that:
Operates or can be made to operate by inserting, depositing, or placing with another person money, a token, or another object; and
Through the use of skill awards the user:
Merchandise or prizes;
A ticket, token, or other object that represents or that can be converted into merchandise or prizes; or
The right to receive an item specified in §B(6)(b)(i) or (ii) of this regulation.
